GhostTypes.Name: Spirit
GhostTypes.Description: A Spirit is the most common Ghost you will come across however it is still very powerful and dangerous. They are usually discovered at one of their hunting grounds after an unexplained death.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Using Smudge Sticks on a spirit will stop it attacking for a long period of time.

GhostTypes.Name: Poltergeist
GhostTypes.Description: One of the most famous Ghosts, a Poltergeist, also known as a noisy ghost can manipulate objects around it to spread fear into its victims.
GhostTypes.Strengths: A Poltergeist can throw huge amounts of objects at once.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: A Poltergeist is almost ineffective in an empty room.

GhostTypes.Name: Mare
GhostTypes.Description: A Mare is the source of all nightmares, making it most powerful in the dark.
GhostTypes.Strengths: A Mare will have an increased chance to attack in the dark.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Turning the lights on around the Mare will lower its chance to attack.

GhostTypes.Name: Demon
GhostTypes.Description: A Demon is one of the worst Ghosts you can encounter. It has been known to attack without a reason
GhostTypes.Strengths: Demons will attack more often than any other Ghost.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Asking a Demon successful questions on the Ouija Board won't lower the user's sanity.

GhostTypes.Name: Yokai
GhostTypes.Description: A common type of ghost that is attracted to human voices. They can usually be found haunting family homes.
GhostTypes.Strengths: Talking near a Yokai will anger it and cause it to attack more often.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: While hunting, it can only hear voices close to it

GhostTypes.Name: Myling
GhostTypes.Description: A Myling is a very vocal and active ghost. They are rumoured to be quiet when hunting their prey.
GhostTypes.Strengths: A Myling is known to be quieter when hunting.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Mylings more frequently make paranormal sounds.

GhostTypes.Name: Wraith
GhostTypes.Description: A wraith is one of the most dangerous ghosts you will find. It is also the only known Ghost that has the ability of flight and has sometimes been known to travel through walls.
GhostTypes.Strengths: Wraiths almost never touch the ground meaning it can't be tracked by footsteps.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Wraiths have a toxic reaction to Salt.

GhostTypes.Name: Banshee
GhostTypes.Description: A Banshee is a natural hunter and will attack anything. It has been known to stalk its prey one at a time until making its kill.
GhostTypes.Strengths: A Banshee will only target one person at a time.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Banshees fear the Crucifix and will be less aggressive when near one.

GhostTypes.Name: Revenant
GhostTypes.Description: A Revenant is a slow but violent ghost that will attack indiscriminately. It has been rumoured to travel at a significantly high speed when hunting.
GhostTypes.Strengths: A Revenant will travel at a significantly faster speed when hunting a victim.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Hiding from the Revenant will cause it to move very slowly.

GhostTypes.Name: Yurei
GhostTypes.Description: A Yurei is a Ghost that has returned to the physical world, usually for the purpose of revenge or hatred.
GhostTypes.Strengths: Yurei's have been known to have a stronger effect on people sanity.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Smudging the Yurei's room will cause it to not wander around the location for a long time.

GhostTypes.Name: Hantu
GhostTypes.Description: A rare ghost that can be found in hot climates. They are known to attack more often in cold weather

GhostTypes.Name: Phantom
GhostTypes.Description: A Phantom is a ghost that can possess the living, most commonly summoned by a Ouija Board. It also induces fear into those around it.
GhostTypes.Strengths: Looking at a Phantom will considerably drop your sanity.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Taking a photo of the Phantom will make it temporarily disappear.

GhostTypes.Name: Jinn
GhostTypes.Description: A Jinn is a territorial ghost that will attack when threatened. It has also been known to be able to travel at significant speed.
GhostTypes.Strengths: A Jinn will travel at a faster speed if its victim is far away.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Turning off the locations power source will prevent the Jinn from using its ability.

GhostTypes.Name: Shade
GhostTypes.Description: A Shade is known to be a Shy Ghost. There is evidence that a Shade will stop all paranormal activity if there are multiple people nearby.
GhostTypes.Strengths: As a shy ghost, a Shade will rarely perform actions in the presence of two or more people, making it harder to detect.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Conversely, a Shade will rarely start a Hunt when players are grouped together.

GhostTypes.Name: Oni
GhostTypes.Description: Onis are a cousin to the Demon and possess extreme strength. There have been rumors that they become more active around their prey.
GhostTypes.Strengths: Oni are more active when people are nearby and have been seen moving objects at great speed.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Being more active will make the Oni easier to find and identify.

GhostTypes.Name: Goryo
GhostTypes.Description: Using a video camera is the only way to view a Goryo, when it passes through a DOTS projector.
GhostTypes.Strengths: Goryo will usually only show itself on camera when there are no people nearby.
GhostTypes.Weaknesses: Goryo are rarely seen far from their place of death

Items.Name: DOTS Projector
Items.Description: The D.O.T.S Projector is a piece of electronic Starter Equipment, as well as a type of Evidence, that can be used to reveal the ghost running across it very quickly.
Tips: Looking at the D.O.T.S Projector using a Video Camera with night vision on may help as it will make the silhouette easier to see.

Placing down both D.O.T.S Projectors in the room makes it much more likely that you see the Ghost's silhouette as you may see they D.O.T.S Projectors grey silhouette on top of the regular black silhouette appearances.
D.O.T.S Projectors can be placed on the floor to make cover much more of the floor in wide open rooms.

Items.Name: Fingerprints
Items.Description: A ghost will leave behind Fingerprints when it interacts with the environment, the most reliable being the following: doors, light switches, windows. These Fingerprints can be seen with a UV Flashlight or the Glowstick.
Tips: Fingerprints do not have to be visible when being photographed by a Photo Camera, and will be labeled as "Fingerprints" in the Journal. This may allow for Fingerprints to be discovered accidentally with an errant photograph.

When Fingerprints evidence is suspected but can not be seen (e.g. small fingerprints on a cell door in Prison) , then one way to check for them is to take a photograph of the area and then look in the Journal for a photo labelled "Fingerprints."

Items.Name: Ghost Orbs
Items.Description: Ghost Orbs can be found floating around the Ghost Room. They look like very small orbs that glide across the screen, generally one at a time. They can be seen on the Computer via the map's Video Feed, a Video Camera or a Head Mounted Camera; night vision must be enabled for them to be visible.
Tips: Camera placement is key to detecting Ghost Orbs. A good strategy for detecting them is placing two Video Cameras in the corners of the room facing each other to maximize coverage.
Ghost Orbs tend to show up in regular intervals. If you don't see any for a long time, try moving the camera or switch to another one.
